TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TreeNodeEventArgs extends System.EventArgs
Public NotInheritable Class TreeNodeEventArgs Inherits EventArgs
public ref class TreeNodeEventArgs sealed : EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the , , , , and events of the control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs> class is used to store the event data that is passed to an event-handling method.
For a list of the initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs> class, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs.%23ctor%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode%29>.
For more information about how to handle events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to populate a node dynamically using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs> object that is passed to the event-handling method.
[!code-aspx-csharp[TreeViewPopulateNodesFromClient#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewPopulateNodesFromClient/CS/treeviewpopulatenodesfromclientcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TreeViewPopulateNodesFromClient#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewPopulateNodesFromClient/VB/treeviewpopulatenodesfromclientvb.aspx#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs> class.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor is used primarily by control developers when raising events.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs> class.
|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs.Node%2A>|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> contained in `node`.|

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Node As TreeNode

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the node that raised the event.
Docs.value: A that represents the node that raised the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs.Node%2A> property to access the properties of the node that raised the event. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs.Node%2A> property returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object and is commonly used to determine the contents of the node, to modify the properties of the node, or to add child nodes dynamically.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs.Node%2A> property to determine the text value of an expanded node.
[!code-aspx-csharp[TreeViewTreeNodeExpand#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewTreeNodeExpand/CS/treeviewtreenodeexpandcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TreeViewTreeNodeExpand#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewTreeNodeExpand/VB/treeviewtreenodeexpandvb.aspx#1)]
